alert.note: Alert for Cass (North Dakota) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Eastern ND and Grand Forks (Northeastern North Dakota and Northwestern Minnesota)
info.headline: Flood Warning issued April 19 at 11:33AM CDT until April 23 at 7:00AM CDT by NWS Eastern ND and Grand Forks
info.description: ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Minnesota...North Dakota... Red River of the North at Wahpeton affecting Richland and Wilkin Counties. Red River of the North near Hickson affecting Cass County. Red River of the North at Oslo affecting Polk, Marshall, Grand Forks and Walsh Counties. Red River of the North at Halstad affecting Norman and Traill Counties. Red River of the North at East Grand Forks affecting Polk and Grand Forks Counties. Red River of the North at Fargo affecting Cass and Clay Counties. Wild Rice River (ND) near Abercrombie affecting Richland County. ...The Flood Warning is extended for the following rivers in Minnesota...North Dakota... Red River of the North at Pembina affecting Pembina and Kittson Counties. Red River of the North at Drayton affecting Walsh, Marshall, Pembina and Kittson Counties. .Snowmelt river flooding to continue. Rate of rise and ultimate crest is uncertain due to rate of ongoing snowmelt runoff and possible rain, snow, and colder temperatures in the forecast. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. ...FLOOD WARNING FOR SNOWMELT NOW IN EFFECT FROM FRIDAY AFTERNOON TO SUNDAY MORNING... * WHAT...Minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Red River of the North near Hickson. * WHEN...From Friday afternoon to Sunday morning. * IMPACTS...At 30.0 feet, MINOR FLOOD. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 10:45 AM CDT Wednesday the stage was 27.9 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise to a crest of 30.0 feet early Friday afternoon. It will then fall below flood stage early Saturday morning. - Flood stage is 30.0 feet. &&
info.instruction: Please report observed flooding to local emergency services or law enforcement and request they pass this information to the National Weather Service when you can do so safely. Safety message - Turn around, don`t drown. Don`t travel through flooded areas. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
